intro: Dyssodia remota, commonly known as the remote dyssodia, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in cool, temperate climates. Its flowers are small and yellow, often arranged in dense clusters, and it produces small, oval-shaped fruits. Due to its specific habitat requirements, Dyssodia remota is considered a rare and less-studied species in botanical research.
